meanings.definition: The performance of actions without conscious thought or intention.
meanings.sent1: She experienced automatisms while sleepwalking, moving around without realizing it.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that automatisms like blinking and breathing are natural bodily functions.
meanings.sent3: His automatisms kicked in when he started dancing to the music without even trying.
meanings.sent4: The gears of the clock worked with automatisms, ticking away the time effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: Automatisms are like a silent orchestra playing in the background of our daily lives.

meanings.definition: A behavior that is involuntary or reflexive.
meanings.sent1: Her automatisms of scratching her head when nervous were noticeable to others.
meanings.sent2: Yawning is one of the automatisms that can be contagious among people.
meanings.sent3: The dog's automatisms of wagging its tail whenever it saw a treat were adorable.
meanings.sent4: His laughter seemed to be an automatisms triggered by any joke, no matter how bad.
meanings.sent5: Automatisms are like little habits that our bodies do without us even thinking about it.

meanings.definition: The use of automatic equipment or devices.
meanings.sent1: The factory relied on automatisms to streamline their production process.
meanings.sent2: Automatisms in the kitchen, like a dishwasher, can save time and effort.
meanings.sent3: The automatisms in the car made driving easier and more convenient.
meanings.sent4: The future of technology lies in the development of advanced automatisms.
meanings.sent5: Automatisms are like little helpers that make our tasks simpler and faster.
